name: Los Rayos iPad Sleeve
description:
This INKAcase iPad sleeve is handmade, using only natural plant dyes and is comprised of 100% sheep's wool. The iconography of this case displays many little suns with rays extending outward. Down the middle of the sleeve are repeating hearts in light blue. This case fits iPad 2 and iPad 3. 

Worried about hurting your iPad? Worry not - we've got you covered. Inside, there's a layer of protective padding, and we use our signature quilt design to make sure you get the longest life out of its protection. It's one of the many things that sets INKAcase apart from other tablet sleeves.

Proceeds directly benefit the artisans by increasing income, technical training, financial literacy, and additional community projects of the AASD.

options.name: Default

name: Ojos de Aqua iPad Sleeve
description:
This INKAcase iPad sleeve is handmade, using only natural plant dyes and is comprised of 100% sheep's wool. The iconography of this case displays what the Quechua people call, "Eyes of the water," something very difficult and rare to see. Some go their entire life without seeing the "eyes of the water." This case fits iPad 2 and iPad 3. 

Worried about hurting your iPad? Worry not - we've got you covered. Inside, there's a layer of protective padding, and we use our signature quilt design to make sure you get the longest life out of its protection. It's one of the many things that sets INKAcase apart from other tablet sleeves.

name: Purple Trails iPad Sleeve
description:
This protective iPad sleeve is handmade, using only natural plant dyes and is comprised of 100% sheep's wool. The zig-zag pattern represents the trails connecting each village in the Lares Valley of Peru.

This sleeve fits the new iPad 3 and iPad 2.

Proceeds directly benefit the artisans by increasing income, technical training, financial literacy, and additional community projects of the AASD.

name: 13" Computer Case: Mountains and Lakes
description:
This protective laptop INKAcase is handmade, using only natural plant dyes and is comprised of 100% sheep's wool. There are two versions of this case - one has a dark red center strip depicting the lakes and rivers of the region and the other has a grey center strip depicting the mountains and rivers near the Choquecancha community. Take your pick!

This case fits 13" laptops, MacBooks, MacBook Airs, and MacBook Pros. 

Worried about hurting your laptop? Worry not - we've got you covered. Inside, there's a layer of protective padding, and we use our signature quilt design to make sure you get the longest life out of its protection. It's one of the many things that sets INKAcase apart from other laptop cases.

Proceeds directly benefit the artisans by increasing income, technical training, financial literacy, and additional community projects of the AASD.

name: 13" Computer Case: Quipu
description:
This protective laptop case is handmade, using only natural plant dyes and is comprised of 100% sheep's wool. The iconography depicts the quipu, an ancient method of communication used in the Andean region dating back to 3,000 B.C.

This case fits 13" MacBook Pros. This particular product ships from Peru, so it may take 3 weeks to arrive in the US.

Proceeds directly benefit the artisans by increasing income, technical training, financial literacy, and additional community projects of the AASD.

options.name: Default

name: Green Andes Mountains
description:
This protective laptop case is handmade, using only natural plant dyes and is comprised of 25% alpaca's wool and 75% sheep's wool. The design of this case reflects the Andes mountains and lush jungle of Parobamba, a small community near Manú National Park where this textile was made. 

This case fits 13" laptops, MacBooks, MacBook Airs, and MacBook Pros.

Please note: This case is one of our older versions, so it does not have our signature INKAcase quilted design inside.

Proceeds directly benefit the artisans by increasing income, technical training, financial literacy, and additional community projects of the AASD.

options.name: Default

name: Seeds for A Family Greenhouse
description:
Our Family Greenhouse Project, initiated in June 2012, has assisted 15 families in the community of Maucau build individual greenhouses. Over the next two months, families will partake in weekly ecological agriculture workshops and receive technical assistance with their greenhouses.

Results indicate that a family greenhouse coupled with adequate training has a direct and substantial impact on food security and malnutrition for these rural indigenous communities. Because of the success we are seeing with the Maucau family greenhouses, we will be expanding the Family Greenhouse Initiative to another community, Pampacorral. We expect 40 family greenhouses to be built, which brings the total number of people directly benefiting from nutritious veggies to approximately 280. Think of the impact for generations to come!

Your $20 investment goes to purchase seeds for 1 family greenhouse to grow nutritious veggies such as tomatoes, cauliflower, cabbage, radishes, kale, lettuce, beets, and spinach. This "purchase" is a tax-deductible donation to the Andean Alliance for Sustainable Development, a registered 501c3.

options.name: 1 year of seeds for a family greenhouse
1 year of seeds for 2 family greenhouses
Purchases the building materials for 1 greenhouse

name: Small Business and Textile Workshops
description:
Help us fund additional workshops for the 18 women of Wiñay Warmi weaving association. Your $300 "purchase" will fund a weekend (8 hours of instruction, wool, dyes etc.) workshop for the weavers covering some of the following topics:

     * Capacity-building: topics to be covered are string tension and further natural plant dying processes, including sustainable growing techniques and harvesting levels.
    *  Small Business: basic courses in financial literacy, saving and product investment, group governance, and marketing.

Your investment goes to further voice and independence of indigenous women of Choquecancha, Peru. This "purchase" is a tax-deductible donation to the Andean Alliance for Sustainable Development, a registered 501c3.

options.name: Default

name: Sheep Climbing Mountain Print
description:
As part of the AASD's Children of Inti art classes, this photo was taken by a student from the rural mountainside village of Pampacorral, Peru. It offers a rare and unique glimpse of indigenous life in the Peruvian Andes as seen through the eyes of a child. In this photo, a student takes the flock of sheep to pasture via a short-cut up the mountain.

* Ordered prints will not include the AASD logo unless specifically requested.

Sizes
Four standard print sizes up to 18x24 inch; custom sizes also available upon request (please email TheAndeanAlliance@gmail.com for price estimates).

Mounting
Custom black or white matboard frame included with all orders.

Shipping
USPS First Class shipping (3 - 5 day average) to anywhere in the US in padded envelop included with all orders.

name: Puya Twins Print
description:
As part of the AASD's Children of Inti art classes, this photo was taken by a student from the rural mountainside village of Pampacorral, Peru. It offers a rare and unique glimpse of indigenous life in the Peruvian Andes as seen through the eyes of a child. Here, twin students stand in front of a puya plant, which is commonly known as "Queen of the Andes". The puya plant is only found in the high Andes and may take 20 years to bloom.  

* Ordered prints will not include the AASD logo unless specifically requested.

Sizes
Four standard print sizes up to 18x24 inch; custom sizes also available upon request (please email TheAndeanAlliance@gmail.com for price estimates).

Mounting
Custom black or white matboard frame included with all orders.

Shipping
USPS First Class shipping (3 - 5 day average) to anywhere in the US in padded envelop included with all orders.
